content:
Diagnosis:
Translocation renal cell carcinoma (TFEB rearranged) of right kidney upper pole
Stage T2N0M0 at diagnosis

Previous treatment:
Right partial nephrectomy 15 March 2024

Histology:
Translocation renal cell carcinoma, TFEB rearrangement confirmed on FISH testing
Tumor size 7.2cm
Negative margins
No lymphovascular invasion

Current situation:
Post-operative review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent partial nephrectomy. He has made an excellent recovery from surgery with good wound healing and minimal post-operative pain. His renal function remains stable with creatinine 98 umol/L compared to pre-operative baseline of 92 umol/L.

CT chest/abdomen/pelvis performed on 12 April 2024 shows expected post-operative changes in the right kidney upper pole with no evidence of residual or recurrent disease. No concerning features elsewhere.

Given the unusual histological subtype and size >7cm, we have discussed changing from the original surveillance plan to consideration of adjuvant immunotherapy. I have explained the rationale, potential benefits and risks of pembrolizumab in this setting. [redacted name] wishes to proceed with adjuvant treatment.

Plan:
To commence pembrolizumab 400mg IV every 6 weeks for 9 cycles
Baseline thyroid function, cortisol and autoimmune screen arranged
Review in 3 weeks with results prior to cycle 1
Continue 3-monthly CT surveillance as previously planned
